fields.caption: Ashley Hardin at home in Seattle in February. Ms. Hardin still owes almost all of the $150,000 she borrowed to attend Brooks Institute of Photography. Now she works as a waitress and pays more to her lender each month than to her landlord.

Jack Remondi, then vice chairman and chief financial officer of Sallie Mae, testifying at a Senate hearing in 2008 about the effects of the lending crisis on the student loan market. Mr. Remondi is now chief executive of Navient.
Culinary students at a Le Cordon Bleu school in Portland, Ore., in 2010.
